intro: Dinebra secunda, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees, primarily in the southeastern United States. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually a glossy green, and its flowers are white or pale pink, often arranged in clusters. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are a food source for birds and other animals. Botanically, it belongs to the family Viscaceae and is characterized by its ability to photosynthesize while also drawing nutrients from its host.
